kept.Description: Whether the participant's data is kept for fMRI analyses. The perfomance on the probe detection task (maintask) must be above 80% correct

block_number.Description: Sequential position of the block within the run

sequential_position.Description: position of the stimulus in the current block

stim.Description: Displayed Stimulus (or [response] for button press). Note that probes are displayed in uppercase

trial_number.LongName: Sequential position of the trial in the run

trial_structure.Description: whether the sequence is structured (phrase) or not (list)

trial_length.Description: number of actual words in the sequence (1 to 4)

sequential_position.Description: position of the current stimulus in the stream

probe_type.Description: whether the probe belongs to the previous sequence

probe_position.Description: sequential position of the probe item in the previous sequence (-1 if not present)

response_correct.Description: whether the subject pressed the correct response key

response_key.Description: code of the response key pressed by the participants

response_time.Description: response times since the onset of display of the probe

1.0.0	2020-06-20

	- Initial snapshot
README:
Dataset associated with the paper "An f{MRI} study of composition in short noun and verb phrases".

"To better characterize the brain regions involved in merging words into phrases, an fMRI experiment was designed to examine their responses to short phrases of varying length (1 to 4 words long), and to matched scrambled lists of words."

After running fmriprep on this dataset, the code at 
https://github.com/l-bg/simple_composition_fmri allows you to perform the analyses and reproduce the figures of the paper
